document_title: Arm lymphedema: Causes, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
To diagnose arm lymphedema, there are the following methods:
Vascular Doppler ultrasound: An accurate, fast method to determine damage at the site of edema; Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI): This method helps examine the tissues and characteristics of edema; Computed tomography (CT): Helps show congested areas of the lymphatic system.; Radionuclide imaging: Using radioactive dye to observe the entire lymphatic system. However, this method is currently less popular in Vietnam because of its high technical requirements.
